name: Stance
description: The karateka neutral position at the beginning of kata is the same (but without swords) as the famous swordsman Musashi in a defensive 'Open on all eight sides' position (happo biraki) that allows no opening to attack from any direction.

name: Bow
description: The bow is a sign of respect and peace. Respect for the traditions, respect for the people you train with and it shows your peaceful intentions.

name: Oi tsuki
description: Oi tsuki is a basic punching technique taught by Karate styles such as Shotokan. It is also known in English as a lunge punch, step-in punch, front punch, forward punch, stepping punch, etc. You might also find this Karate technique spelled as Oizuki, Oi Zuki, etc.

name: Gedan barai
description: Gedan barai, or downward block is one of the most commonly used karate techniques

name: Age uke
description: Age Uke (upper block, rising block) is one of the first blocks practiced in shotokan karate.

name: Shuto uke
description: Shuto uke (knife hand block) is one of the more tricky techniques, especially when stepping in kokutsu dachi (shotokan back stance).
